methods.void addCallback(Toast.Callback callback: Adds a callback to be notified when the toast is shown or hidden.
methods.void cancel(): Close the view if it's showing, or don't show it if it isn't showing yet.
methods.int getGravity(): Get the location at which the notification should appear on the screen.
methods.int getXOffset(): Return the X offset in pixels to apply to the gravity's location.
methods.int getYOffset(): Return the Y offset in pixels to apply to the gravity's location.
methods.Toast makeText(Context context, int resI: Make a standard toast that just contains text from a resource.
methods.Toast makeText(Context context, CharSequ: Make a standard toast that just contains text.
methods.void removeCallback(Toast.Callback callb: Removes a callback previously added with addCallback(android.widget.Toast.Callback).
methods.void setDuration(int duration): Set how long to show the view for.
methods.void setGravity(int gravity, int xOffset: Set the location at which the notification should appear on the screen.
methods.void setMargin(float horizontalMargin, f: Set the margins of the view.
methods.void setText(int resId): Update the text in a Toast that was previously created using one of the makeText() methods.
methods.void setText(CharSequence s): Update the text in a Toast that was previously created using one of the makeText() methods.
methods.void setView(View view): This method was deprecated in API level 30. Custom toast views are deprecated. Apps can create a standard text toast with the makeText(android.content.Context, java.lang.CharSequence, int) method, or use a Snackbar when in the foreground. Starting from Android Build.VERSION_CODES#R, apps targeting API level Build.VERSION_CODES#R or higher that are in the background will not have custom toast views displayed.
methods.void show(): Show the view for the specified duration.
